choices.text:
in python calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
To calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers in Python, you can use the `statistics` module. Here's an example code snippet to help you get started:
```python
import statistics

numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
average = statistics.mean(numbers)
standard_deviation = statistics.stdev(numbers)

print("Average:", average)
print("Standard Deviation:", standard_deviation)
```
This code will calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers, which in this case is `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]`. You can replace that list with any other list of numbers you want to compute the statistics for.
